FuncDef: The reset pim ipv6 control-message counters command deletes statistics about IPv6 PIM control messages. The reset pim ipv6 control-message counters command deletes statistics about IPv6 PIM control messages. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: reset pim ipv6 control-message counters [ interface { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> } ]
reset pim ipv6 { vpn-instance <instance-name> | all-instance } control-messagecounters [ interface { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> } ]

ParaDef.Info:
Deletes statistics about IPv6 PIM control messages on a specified interface type.
-

Deletes statistics about IPv6 PIM control messages on a specified interface number.
-

Specifies the name of an interface.
-

Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The VPN instance name cannot be _public_. If the character string is quoted by double quotation marks, the character string can contain spaces.

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset pim ipv6 control-message counters interface 100GE 1/0/1
